page.title: 08Baldwins Gate School
page.content: This rural school has about 100 pupils on role. It is a fairly modern building, built to accomodate the merging of three local smaller parish schools some fourteen years ago. At present, pupils come by various means of transport; private cars, walking, school bus and taxi.The taxi brings in a small number of pupils who live in outlying areas, but the rest of the children seem equally divided between the other means of getting to school. There are five teachers, one part-time, including the Headmaster,one secetary, one ancillary assistant, one cleaner/caretaker and five dinner ladies.
